title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket bought in Marlborough, Mass., remains unclaimed and will expire on Nov. 20, 2025.
The winning ticket for the Nov. 20, 2024, drawing was purchased at New Capital Farms Convenience Store on Boston Post Road.
Expired prize money will be redistributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns if the winner doesn't claim it in time.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia married on Halloween in Salem's Willows Park.
The bride wore a black dress and veil, carrying black and red flowers during the ceremony.
The couple spent a week in Salem before the wedding, exploring the area and awaiting their marriage license.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points on 13-for-19 shooting in a 109-108 win over the 76ers.
The Celtics faced a late-game struggle but maintained their lead to secure their third consecutive victory.
Boston's Hugo González contributed with high energy play, recording five rebounds and five fouls in 15 minutes.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox wore a controversial Halloween outfit resembling Jackie Kennedy's bloodied Chanel suit from the 1963 assassination.
Jack Schlossberg, Kennedy's grandson, criticized Fox's costume on social media, labeling it as "disgusting, desperate and dangerous."
Fox defended her outfit as a statement on trauma and power, highlighting Jackie Kennedy's refusal to change her blood-stained clothes.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Michael Penix Jr. and Drake London set to play against Patriots after missing last week's game due to injuries.
London has 38 catches on 63 targets with two touchdowns and ranks as the sixth-best WR, according to Pro Football Focus.
Christian Gonzalez, top-ranked Patriots cornerback, has not allowed a touchdown in his last 478 coverage snaps.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox chief Craig Breslow believes the team is better positioned to acquire top players in the offseason.
Breslow acknowledges roster gaps with Alex Bregman's opt-out and possible departures of Lucas Giolito and Trevor Story.
Red Sox are $25 million under luxury tax, with a strong farm system and standout prospects like Roman Anthony.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel, Patriots coach, insists changes aren’t to separate from past success, but to improve team play.
Week 8 introduction saw individual player announcements, ending a 24-year tradition of team introductions.
Patriots' modifications include dropping former chants and phrases, with Vrabel emphasizing competitive focus.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained in overtime against the Sabres.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm confirmed Lindholm's injury requires an MRI after colliding with Sabres' Jordan Greenway.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to the top-line center, joining David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie for the Bruins.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists in costume filled Salem on Halloween 2025, the city's busiest day of the year.
Essex Street was bustling with people dressed as Sanderson sisters and other iconic Halloween figures.
Salem Common featured markets, street performances, and a Witches' Circle attracting Halloween enthusiasts.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein without providing evidence during an MSNBC interview.
Moulton claims it is 'obvious' Trump is in the Epstein files, challenged by host Joe Scarborough on lack of evidence.
Moulton is running against Sen. Ed Markey in the 2026 Democratic primary and aims to focus on class issues in elections.
